      • readResponseString

        public static java.lang.String readResponseString(java.net.HttpURLConnection con)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the response body and returns it as a string.
        Parameters:
        con - the HTTP connection
        Returns:
        the string containing the response body
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading the response stream fails

      • readResponse

        public static byte[] readResponse(java.net.HttpURLConnection con)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the response body and returns it in a byte array.
        Parameters:
        con - the HTTP connection
        Returns:
        the byte array containing the response body. Note that if you pass in a buffer, this will the same buffer object. Be sure to check the content length to know what data in the buffer is valid (from zero to contentLength).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading the response stream fails.

      • writeRequest

        public static void writeRequest(java.net.HttpURLConnection con,
                java.lang.String content)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Simply writes the given content to the given connection's output stream. WARNING: DO NOT connect the connection before calling this method (it will be connected here)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
